2023-09-24T06:52:28Z:
And with that, we will bid you farewell until Qatar. Congratulations to constructors' champions Red Bull and race winner Verstappen. To catch up on all the action, the race report is below. https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-japanese-gp-race-report/10524573/
    
Max Verstappen, Red Bull Racing RB19, Lando Norris, McLaren MCL60
Photo by: Andy Hone / Motorsport Images
2023-09-24T06:50:31Z: As Verstappen climbs onto the top step of the podium, a familiar pair of anthems ring out at Suzuka.
2023-09-24T06:41:44Z: In the constructors' race for P4, things are closing between McLaren and Aston Martin. The former arrived in Japan trailing by 78 points, and the margin is now below 50. With six races to go, this battle has a long way to run.
2023-09-24T06:37:31Z: Russell, Alonso, Ocon and Gasly round out the top 10.
2023-09-24T06:37:11Z: Leclerc is fourth and Hamilton holds on from Sainz for P5.
2023-09-24T06:36:35Z: But for now, let's focus on McLaren as Norris takes second and Piastri scores his maiden F1 podium in third.
2023-09-24T06:35:53Z: Verstappen can clinch the drivers' crown in the Qatar sprint in a fortnight.
2023-09-24T06:35:22Z: The chequered flag is taken by Verstappen, and Red Bull are the 2023 Formula 1 constructors' champions!
2023-09-24T06:34:50Z: While Verstappen has been out of sight for the duration, this has been a striking return to form. A 13th win of the year, a 48th of his career, and the constructors' championship for Red Bull. Not a bad Japanese GP for Red Bull all told!
2023-09-24T06:33:44Z: Verstappen currently has a 20s lead with Norris 16s clear of third-placed Piastri.
2023-09-24T06:32:38Z: Onto the final lap we go and Verstappen has been faultless today.
2023-09-24T06:30:30Z: Hamilton is told to keep giving Russell DRS but Sainz is all over him. Sainz pulls to the inside of Turn 1 and Russell will be apoplectic in his cockpit.
2023-09-24T06:26:10Z: The Mercedes battle is not the only one between team-mates, as Ocon is less than 1s behind Gasly, and the same goes for Lawson and Tsunoda.
2023-09-24T06:25:55Z: Ferrari heartrates can ease. No further action on Leclerc.
2023-09-24T06:25:25Z: But hold on a second, Leclerc is under investigation for his move on Russell, after running wide across the kerb when completing the pass.
2023-09-24T06:25:22Z: Catching both Mercedes drivers is Sainz in P7. The Ferrari man is just over one second behind the pair.
2023-09-24T06:24:50Z: Hamilton is now back up with Russell. Team orders or let them race? This will be interesting after the earlier incident.
2023-09-24T06:22:33Z: Leclerc finally makes his move, braving it around the outside of turns one and two. That was as close as you can get without contact.
2023-09-24T06:20:37Z: Lap 44 and its close, but not close enough for Leclerc on Russell. Meanwhile, Hamilton is still closing.
2023-09-24T06:18:34Z: There is no let-up for Russell as Leclerc is now on his gearbox. Hamilton is also rapidly closing on his Mercedes team-mate.
2023-09-24T06:17:13Z: A clean exit out of the Spoon, a good run through 130R...Piastri makes it stick this time around the outside of Turn 1. The Australian is 10 laps from a maiden F1 podium.
2023-09-24T06:16:51Z: Outside the points, Lawson is some 13s behind Gasly and is being gradually caught by AlphaTauri team-mate Tsunoda.
2023-09-24T06:16:02Z: The lower reaches of the top 10 have settled down a bit now. Sainz after his pitstop sits seventh from Alonso, with the two Alpines of Ocon and Gasly completing the point scoring positions.
2023-09-24T06:15:51Z: With DRS, Piastri is marginally too far back on Russell to make his move for the final podium place. Next time...
2023-09-24T06:14:14Z: Verstappen punts in a new fastest lap with a 1m34.183s effort. As ever, the Dutchman is keen to hoover up all the points that are on offer.
2023-09-24T06:12:54Z: Remember when we said Perez was back in his car. Well, he's still sat there in the garage. But the tyre blankets are off and he looks like he is ready to rejoin. Just the 26 laps down...
2023-09-24T06:12:39Z: Finally, Sainz stops from P2. Mediums off, hards on and he drops to P7 but with the advantage of fresher rubber.
2023-09-24T06:10:56Z: Norris wastes no time regaining his position from Russell and moves up to P3 with an easy run into Turn 1.
2023-09-24T06:10:16Z: Verstappen now stops from the lead and...exits with an 8s margin at the front still.
2023-09-24T06:09:20Z: Dropping behind Sainz briefly, Norris slots in just behind Russell but with far fresher rubber.
2023-09-24T06:08:44Z: We were correct. In comes Norris from P2. Off come the hard Pirellis and on goes a new set of the same compound.
2023-09-24T06:08:10Z: Gasly moves back into the points at the expense of Hulkenberg.
2023-09-24T06:07:55Z: Hards go on for Piastri and he exits clear of Leclerc, slotting into P5. Sainz stays out, bizarrely.
2023-09-24T06:07:36Z: Gasly is another driver to pit from P8 and drops to P11. The Alpine driver is having a quiet but steady race.
2023-09-24T06:06:54Z: And McLaren reacts immediately with Piastri to protect him from the undercut. Norris will likely follow suit next time around.
2023-09-24T06:05:38Z: As we say that, Leclerc pits from P5 and Hamilton is also in from P6.
2023-09-24T06:05:17Z: With tyres lasting around 20 laps at best so far, we're now rapidly approaching the pit window for those on two-stop plans.
2023-09-24T06:01:55Z: Well this won't do Alonso's mood any good. His Aston Martin team come over the radio to say they retired Stroll's car due to a rear wing failure, but can see no problems with the Spaniard's machine, at least for the moment...
2023-09-24T05:59:44Z: Tsunoda is in for his second stop. It's 2.6s as he swaps the soft tyre for hards and he comes back out in P14.
2023-09-24T05:58:20Z: The gaps at the front are remaining relatively stable now, with the only change of note being Norris' pace over Piastri behind. His race is for P2, given Verstappen holds a 14s lead at the front.
2023-09-24T05:57:17Z: Meanwhile, Alonso has pitted for a new set of hard tyres and demotes Tsunoda for P9.
2023-09-24T05:56:17Z: It may have something to do with the penalty for hitting Magnussen, which if left unserved here, may well be carried over into the next race.
2023-09-24T05:55:39Z: The Mexican is currently 15 laps down on team-mate and leader Verstappen, so one wonders what the point in sending him back out is?
2023-09-24T05:54:50Z: As we say that though, Perez has been strapped back into his Red Bull. And he looks like he's about to head back out!
2023-09-24T05:53:38Z: Things just go from bad to worse for Williams. Albon is also told to retire the car. Just 15 cars left now.
2023-09-24T05:53:28Z: But at the start of lap 27, McLaren reverses the positions. Norris immediately pulls over a second clear of his team-mate.
2023-09-24T05:51:55Z: Sargeant's awful day comes to an end. The Williams driver is the fourth retirement of the race.
2023-09-24T05:50:38Z: Russell immediately moves past Alonso on the exit of Turn 11, and gets Ocon moments later. P7 now for the Brit.
2023-09-24T05:49:42Z: Russell now pits and fits hard tyres. On lap 25 of 53, this will be touch and go as to whether he can make the chequered flag.
2023-09-24T05:49:27Z: Russell pits from second and rejoins P9, behind the squabbling Ocon and Alonso. This should be fun...
2023-09-24T05:49:00Z: The fastest man on the track at this point is Norris, with a recent 1m36.689s the best of the race to this point.
2023-09-24T05:48:12Z: If this is indeed Russell's plan, he is having to really manage his tyres now with Piastri closing to within DRS range.
2023-09-24T05:48:02Z: And as we say that, Gasly moves up to P10.
2023-09-24T05:47:26Z: Behind Alonso, Tsunoda sits 10th but only just from Gasly, with Lawson a few seconds further back.
2023-09-24T05:46:23Z: You get the feeling Alonso is a frustrated man in that Aston Martin, as he darts to the inside of Ocon at Turn 1 but there's no way through.
2023-09-24T05:46:09Z: The battle for P2 is incredibly interesting with Piastri closing on Russell, and Norris also closing on his team-mate.
2023-09-24T05:45:28Z: Stroll is our third retirement of the race. The Aston Martin driver pulls his car into the garage. Game over.
2023-09-24T05:44:37Z: Hamilton is on a charge, demoting Ocon for P7 into Turn 1. Incredibly, his Mercedes team-mate Russell has yet to pit and sits second currently.
2023-09-24T05:42:56Z: Sainz has the superior grip and moves past Ocon down the start/finish straight. Ferrari team-mate Leclerc is next up, three seconds ahead.
2023-09-24T05:41:51Z: Alonso doesn't stay P7 for long. Fellow Spaniard Sainz gets a better drive out of Turn 11 and moves ahead. Next up, Ocon.
2023-09-24T05:41:48Z: In the shakeout of the pitstops, Piastri was indeed able to jump Norris. He holds a 4.5s margin over his McLaren team-mate and is P3, soon to be P2 when Russell pits.
2023-09-24T05:41:10Z: Alonso sits P7 and is all over the back of his old team-mate Ocon ahead. The Alpine driver is on the hard tyre having pitted at the end of lap one.
2023-09-24T05:39:42Z: Russell assumes the lead of the Japanese GP as Sainz pits. Despite having stopped, Verstappen is able to lunge at the hairpin and retake the lead.
2023-09-24T05:39:35Z: It's getting spicy in the middle of the pack as the leading runners have come out of the pits into the midfield runners who have yet to stop.
2023-09-24T05:38:30Z: Norris puts on a set of hard tyres and comes out of the pits in P7, losing on-track position to team-mate Piastri.
2023-09-24T05:36:13Z: Hamilton also pits and rejoins in P10, just ahead of the AlphaTauri pairing of Tsunoda and Lawson.
2023-09-24T05:35:36Z: Verstappen pits. It's a slow one. Mediums off and hards on with the timing showing 3.3s.
2023-09-24T05:35:07Z: Hamilton has run wide off the track at Degner 2 and Russell is now right on his tail. Hamilton runs wide again at Spoon and forces his team-mate off the track. There is a real chance the stewards will take a dim view on that one.
2023-09-24T05:33:38Z: Perez has been told to retire the car, somewhat ironically as he is handed another penalty for his collision with Magnussen. A nightmare race for the Red Bull driver which is in stark comparison to his team-mate.
2023-09-24T05:32:33Z: The new order is Verstappen, Norris, Leclerc, Sainz and Hamilton. Verstappen's lead is 9.1s.
2023-09-24T05:31:58Z: The VSC has ended before the leaders have managed to get back around to the pits. The full benefit of this will become clear in time.
2023-09-24T05:30:58Z: As Piastri stops, the VSC comes out to allow for debris from the Perez-Magnussen incident to be cleared. This could be perfect timing for the Australian if this lasts for less than a lap.
2023-09-24T05:30:12Z: Piastri pits from P3. Mediums off and hards on.
2023-09-24T05:28:51Z: You can't help but get the feeling another penalty might be heading Perez's way after that collision. Both drivers have headed to the pits.
2023-09-24T05:28:28Z: Oh dear. Perez looks to the inside of Magnussen into Turn 11 and the pair make contact. The Haas driver is sent spinning and Perez has damaged his front wing.
2023-09-24T05:27:36Z: The undercut is expected to be extremely powerful today, so Alonso's stop covers the threat from Hamilton behind.
2023-09-24T05:27:04Z: Alonso is another to come in from P6, and the Spaniard has the hard tyre fitted to his Aston Martin.
2023-09-24T05:26:21Z: Lawson, who had been running ninth on softs, has pitted. The first signs that we're in for at least a two-stop race, if not three, with only 10 laps completed.
2023-09-24T05:25:42Z: Onto lap 10 and the gaps continue to grow at the front. Verstappen leads by 3.7s from Norris and, as things stand, Red Bull will be confirmed as the constructors' champions.
2023-09-24T05:25:15Z: The Red Bull driver did drop back, but obviously the stewards deemed his actions worthy of a 5s penalty.
2023-09-24T05:24:39Z: The penalties are coming thick and fast. This time for Perez for a safety car infringement when the Mexican overtook several cars on the exit of the pitlane.
2023-09-24T05:23:13Z: Our first penalty of the race and it's a five-second one for Sargeant for causing that collision with Bottas. And speaking of the Alfa driver, he's parked it in the garage and his grim day is over already.
2023-09-24T05:21:55Z: Home hero Tsunoda is currently running in 10th, but has Stroll keeping him honest behind - both of them currently on the soft tyre.
2023-09-24T05:20:56Z: No further investigation on all the lap one carnage.
2023-09-24T05:20:23Z: Expectations in the lead-up to the race were that there would be little to separate the soft and medium tyres in terms of life. The top five are on mediums with Alonso, P6, on softs. We'll now see how accurate these forecasts were.
2023-09-24T05:19:57Z: The incident between Bottas and Sargeant is unsurprisingly under investigation. Both have made a second stop and we're only on lap 7!
2023-09-24T05:18:30Z: At the front and with DRS now enabled, Verstappen is now two-seconds clear of Norris. Piastri has also dropped back on his team-mate by a similar margin.
2023-09-24T05:18:27Z: Replays show Bottas tried to go around the outside of Sargeant and the pair make heavy contact. Their days are just going from bad to worse.
2023-09-24T05:16:52Z: More drama for Bottas as he goes off at Turn 11. The Finn comes over the radio and is not happy, so possibly he was helped off.
2023-09-24T05:16:30Z: A considerably calmer restart than the original getaway. The early interruption will certainly have caused chaos with some pit strategies.
2023-09-24T05:15:01Z: Verstappen holds the pack back as he creeps around 130R. Into the final chicane, he pins the throttle and we are racing once more!
2023-09-24T05:13:17Z: The safety car will return to the pits at the end of this lap - lap 4.
2023-09-24T05:12:51Z: Incredibly despite all the mayhem, all 20 drivers are currently still running... for now at least.
2023-09-24T05:11:54Z: That was all rather chaotic at the start. Clearly, the drivers have been taking lessons from MotoGP riders on how not to make it around Turn 1!
2023-09-24T05:11:01Z: Perez is another to enter the pits from seventh to replace his front wing, the Red Bull driver having made contact with Hamilton down into Turn 1. The Mexican rejoins at the back of the pack.
2023-09-24T05:10:00Z: All the incidents at lap one, Turn 1 have been noted by race control.
2023-09-24T05:09:49Z: Ooofff! Replays of the start show Albon went airborne briefly after contact with Bottas down into Turn 1. Incredibly though, the Williams driver is back out behind the safety car.
2023-09-24T05:09:19Z: A slow start for Leclerc was the spark that caused the chaos further back, as Sainz was forced to take avoiding action. This made him squeeze Perez, who in turn hit Hamilton off the track.
2023-09-24T05:07:50Z: He's not the only one to come into the pits, as Albon, team-mate Zhou and Ocon also come in.
2023-09-24T05:07:49Z: Looking back to the start, Verstappen goes ultra-defensive on Piastri, pulling across but leaving the door open to Norris, who took the space and attempted a bold move around the outside of turns one and two.
2023-09-24T05:06:48Z: It's Bottas. The Finn has damaged his front wing and has a right front puncture which will require a trip to the pits.
2023-09-24T05:06:27Z: Leclerc and Sainz follow the leaders but the safety car is out already to allow debris from the start to be cleared.
2023-09-24T05:05:50Z: There's contact down the back of the field with the rush into Turn 1, as one of the Alfa Romeo drivers has picked up damage.
2023-09-24T05:05:12Z: Piastri, Norris and Verstappen go wheel-to-wheel but the Red Bull driver retains his advantage as Piastri drops back to P3.
2023-09-24T05:04:25Z: Verstappen and Piastri are nicely angled in at each other on the grid. This could be spicy!
2023-09-24T05:03:26Z: At the final corner and only now does Verstappen begin to back the pack up. But even then, Piastri drops further back. The fun and games are firmly under way!
2023-09-24T05:02:22Z: A bizarre situation on the formation lap with Verstappen flying into the distance while the backmarkers are taking a considerably less hurried pace.
2023-09-24T05:01:49Z: 101,000 fans are packed into the Suzuka facility today.
2023-09-24T05:00:28Z: And with that, the formation lap begins!
2023-09-24T04:59:32Z: After his crash yesterday, Sargeant will start from the pitlane with a 10-second penalty also applied with the FIA judging that Williams in effect had a third car built in advance of timehttps://www.autosport.com/f1/news/sargeant-handed-penalty-for-third-car-rules-breach-ahead-of-f1-japanese-gp/10524579/
2023-09-24T04:57:56Z: 53 laps of action are ahead of us with Verstappen going for career race win 48 and his 13th of the season.
2023-09-24T04:56:36Z: The now-iconic F1 theme plays - as I get a singalong rendition from my two-year-old who appears to have now joined me - and the tension is building.
2023-09-24T04:55:33Z: This is your five-minute warning to lights out!
2023-09-24T04:54:33Z: Given the blue skies overhead, this will come as no surprise - the official chance of rain for the race is 0%!
2023-09-24T04:53:38Z: While this is a big day for Red Bull, it is easy to argue that this race has more significance for Piastri. The Australian has narrowly missed out on the podium several times this year, but starting in P2, this could be his time!
2023-09-24T04:49:27Z: We can't avoid it any longer - tyre talk. Degradation was the buzz word on Saturday and we're expecting a mix of two and three-stop strategies today. With two drivers to challenge Verstappen, McLaren has some freedom for flexibility.
2023-09-24T04:47:48Z: Now, a pause as the Japanese National Anthem plays.
2023-09-24T04:46:39Z: Fred Vasseur has offered a fairly bleak outlook of Ferrari's chances for victory today. However, he was more confident of his driver's ability to work together to challenge McLaren.
2023-09-24T04:40:38Z: T-20. Can anyone stop Verstappen today?
2023-09-24T04:38:53Z: It may not be the most entertaining thing to talk about but the wind direction has flipped 180 degrees from yesterday, with a headwind into 130R and Turn 1, compared to a tailwind in qualifying. This will have a massive effect on the way drivers attack those corners.
2023-09-24T04:37:45Z: The drivers are now all out of the cars as the blazing sun beats down on the track - a stark contrast to 12 months ago! Temperatures are 21.1C air and 45C track.
2023-09-24T04:27:08Z: A word for those joining us in European time zones, well done and welcome! Coffee, energy drinks, a fry-up...let us know your tricks to surviving the early start!
2023-09-24T04:21:12Z: Things are further complicated by the continued performance of McLaren, with Piastri second and Norris third on the grid, with both in somewhat of a no man's land between Verstappen and the chasing pack.
2023-09-24T04:20:17Z: And the task facing Mercedes and Ferrari looks extremely difficult after qualifying, with Verstappen on pole and half-a-second clear of the pack.
2023-09-24T04:18:54Z: The only way that Red Bull can be stopped this weekend, is if Mercedes outscore them or if Ferrari score 24 points more than the current leaders.
2023-09-24T04:17:12Z: The cars are just leaving the pitlane to complete their exploratory laps to the grid as we reach the first chance for Red Bull to seal the constructors' title.
2023-09-24T04:16:28Z: Good morning and welcome to Suzuka for the Japanese Grand Prix!
